Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Shrink Gallery secret caching to 6 hours and update dependencies. " (#7873) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Shrink Gallery secret caching to 6 hours and update dependencies.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Lazy DbContext initialization in OData controllers" (#7872) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Since we do the hijacking for great deal of OData requests we get, having DB contexts injected into OData controllers creates unnecessary connections that are likely to be unused.

This change postpones the context initialization until the moment we know for sure we are going to query the DB.

We have some issues with reporting the DB related perf counters from the app service, so verification was done by collecting profiler traces from different versions of the service.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add KnownOperation telemetry and add more configuration to DI" (#7867) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This change has two main purposes:

1. Add a `KnownOperation` custom dimension so that we can have a metric column with low cardinality that identifies the type of request. Current the `name` (or `operation_Name` in other tables) has extremely high cardinality because some request patterns end up putting the verbatim URL path there.
1. Add more configuration types to the DI container so that closed-source/internal modules can get configuration from DI.
   - Since Gallery does not use `IOptions` or `IConfigurationRoot`, we use the older abstraction in our codebase which is `IConfigurationFactory`. This has been around for a while and is based on `ComponentModel`.
   - Update to new ServerCommon since I moved `StringArrayConverter` there. This allows closed-source implementations to also use `StringArrayConverter` in their own private configuration types.

Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3020

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search]Catalog2AzureSearch can possibly fail on merge" (#7871) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When updating a document with change type UpdateVersionList, we update the document with a Merge operation.

There appear to be cases where the document that we attempt to merge may not exist in the index.
The root cause of this needs to be investigated further, but the attempt to update the non-existent document will cause the job to fail.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Migration option shows up for C++ projects, contrary to documentation" (#9316) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This page states _"You should now be able to see the migration option. Note that this option is not supported and **will not show** up for ASP.NET and C++ project types."_ This is not true on VS2019 16.4.5; right-clicking on an unmanaged C++ project's packages.config file does show the option **Migrate packages.config to PackageReference...**, but attempting to perform the operation fails with a message that the "project is not eligible for migration."

---
#### Document Details

⚠ *Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.*

* ID: 6a154e5f-436d-6297-ec05-4d134a2404f9
* Version Independent ID: 1c782e82-db9a-bf77-05ef-cd49374aee36
* Content: [Migrating from package.config to PackageReference formats](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference)
* Content Source: [docs/consume-packages/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference.md](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/blob/master/docs/consume-packages/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference.md)
* Product: **nuget**
* GitHub Login: @karann-msft
* Microsoft Alias: **karann**

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MSBuild Restore is flaky (with corext bridge)" (#9314) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): msbuild /restore

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): unknown (CloudBuild)

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): n/a

VS version (if appropriate): n/a

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Unknown (CloudBuild)

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: no

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

[This](https://cloudbuild.microsoft.com/build/63e1c919-11df-45b2-ba72-7f082a0a0eae?bq=CDP_PowerQuery-Web) is an example of corext init timing out. From talking to a colleague it seems like msbuild is crashing/hanging when trying to build the list of projects to be restored. msbuild was ran with /bl so there are dump files of the processes here. This is the most common issue we are facing.

[This](https://cloudbuild.microsoft.com/build/b059eaf8-61f2-4c8f-a3f1-11703cd25210?bq=CDP_PowerQuery-Web) is an example where the restore fails. What's odd is there are no warnings or errors in the restore.log. This is less common.

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Included above

### Sample Project

https://msazure.visualstudio.com/One/_git/PowerQuery-Web/

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet nuget push to GPR -- Invalid or unrecognized response" (#8580) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I run the following script in GitHub Actions:

```
      - name: Publish Nuget to GitHub registry
        run: dotnet nuget push ./MyNugetPackage.3.4.24.nupk -s https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/index.json -k ${GITHUB_TOKEN}  
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

and I get the following output:

```

Run nuget push ./MyNugetPackage.3.4.24.nupk -Source https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/index.json
Pushing MyNugetPackage.3.4.24.3.4.24.nupkg to 'https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME'...
  PUT https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/
An error was encountered when fetching 'PUT https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/'. The request will now be retried.
An error occurred while sending the request.
  The server returned an invalid or unrecognized response.
  PUT https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/
An error was encountered when fetching 'PUT https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/'. The request will now be retried.
An error occurred while sending the request.
  The server returned an invalid or unrecognized response.
  PUT https://nuget.pkg.github.com/USERNAME/
An error occurred while sending the request.
  The server returned an invalid or unrecognized response.
##[error]Process completed with exit code 1.
```

I'm running my code inside of `ubuntu-latest` (18.04) that has the following versions installed: [software-in-virtual-environments-for-github-actions](https://help.github.com/en/articles/software-in-virtual-environments-for-github-actions#ubuntu-1804-lts)

Can someone help me explain what this error means? I don't know how to solve this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure] No error occurs after packing a package with an invalid.txt format icon and VS crashed when trying to install" (#9311) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.6.0.6509
VS Version: Master\29916.153
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1.	Create a Class Library (.NET Framework 4.8) in VS and build the solution.
2.	In the Developer Command Prompt for VS, create a nuspec file by executing command “nuget spec”
3.	Make an invalid image file (size limited to 1 MB with a .txt format) and locate in the package. Note: invalid means size limited to 1 MB with PNG/JPEG format and 128x128 resolution
4.	Add following to nuspec file
```
<package>
  <metadata>
    ...
    <icon>images\icon.txt</icon>
    ...
  </metadata>
  <files>
    ...
    <file src="C:\Users\v-luzh\source\repos\Package1\Package1\icon.txt" target="images\" />
    ...
  </files>
</package>
```
5. Pack the package to local path by executing command “nuget pack”.

## Expected
There should be an error to prevent packing a package with a text format icon in step 5.
## Actual
No error occurred after packing a package with a text format icon in step 5 and VS crashed when trying to install this package into a .NET Framework Console App.
## Note
It's not a regression.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] Lock file will not update after changing the project graph structure until reopening the solution" (#9256) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-5.6.0-Preview.1\5.6.0.6483
VS Version: D16.6\29903.66
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1. Create a solution with three .NET Core Class Library projects, make the project graph structure: Lib1 -> Lib2 -> Lib3 (Lib1 reference Lib2 reference Lib3) through “Add reference” context menu in Solution Explorer.  
2. Set property “RestorePackagesWithLockFile” to true in csproj file (as below) of Lib1.
`<RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile> `
3. Click the solution context menu “Restore NuGet Packages” in Solution Explorer, check the lock file and close the solution.
4. Reopen the solution and check the lock file again.
5. Change the project graph structure: Lib1 -> Lib2 & Lib3 through “Add reference” context menu in Solution Explorer (no project reference for Lib2).
6. Click the solution context menu “Restore NuGet Packages” in Solution Explorer and check the lock file again.
## Expected
Lock file will update correctly after changing the project graph structure.
## Actual
Lock file will not update after changing the project graph structure until reopening the solution as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/75872009-64cc7a80-5e48-11ea-943e-5e9ff4872d0f.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support pre-release packages with floating versions" (#912) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Consider a project.json specification such as

```
{
   "A: "1.0.*"
}
```

If the only packages in the feed are prerelease packages such as `A.1.0.0-alpha`, `A.1.0.1-beta`, the restore fails stating it was unable to resolve package `A`.

------------
[anangaur] Adding the requirement as evolved during the discussions:

As Noel, who uses NuGet packages in PackageReference based projects,

- I would like to use floating versions that only resolves to stable versions of the package (Current behavior)
- I would like to use floating version that can resolve to the latest version even if the latest happens to be a pre-release version.
- I should be able to use both the braces/regex formats i.e. 1.* or [1.0.0, 2.0.0) that can include pre-release versions
- I would like to additionally define whether I want to resolve to rc, beta, alpha or all pre-releases.

------------
**Link to spec** - https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Support-pre-release-packages-with-floating-versions
**Status** - reviewed

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
